intro: Pelonastes tuberculata, commonly known as the roughleaf mallow, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its hairy, serrated leaves and produces clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. Pelonastes tuberculata is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
